app_metadata.description: Run your own node of P2Pool, a decentralized Monero mining pool.
app_metadata.name: p2pool

run_as_context.description: Container [p2pool] runs as non-root user and group.

app_metadata.title: P2Pool

attrs.label: Use Remote Node
attrs.description:
Leaving this disabled will attempt to use your installed Monero Node app.
If you do not run the Monero Node app, you need to point to a different Monero node.
Ideally this should be another device that you run, but it can be a node run by a third-party.
Although the Monero software will take certain steps to protect your privacy and security when
connecting to a third-party node, there are still meaningful privacy and security disadvantages.

attrs.label: Monero Node RPC Port
attrs.description: The RPC port of your Monero Node.

attrs.label: Monero Node ZMQ Pub Port
attrs.description: The ZMQ Pub port of your Monero Node.

attrs.label: Peers
attrs.description: Add the P2Pool peers you want to connect to here.

attrs.label: Additional Args
attrs.description:
Additional P2Pool arguments can be provided here.
If you are unsure, leave this blank.</br>
Reference: https://github.com/SChernykh/p2pool/blob/master/docs/COMMAND_LINE.MD#p2pool-command-line-options

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.</br>
NFS Share: Is a NFS share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
